qas.question: What was the Fresno Fairgrounds used as?
What was the white population in 1942 in Fresno?
What percentage of Pinedale is black?

context: Before World War II, Fresno had many ethnic neighborhoods, including Little Armenia, German Town, Little Italy, and Chinatown. In <b7_0>1940<b7_0/>, the Census Bureau reported Fresno's population as <b5_0>94.0%<b5_0/> white, <b6_0>3.3%<b6_0/> black and <a0_0><a0_1><a0_2>2.7%<a0_2/><a0_1/><a0_0/> Asian. (Incongruously, <a1_0><a1_1><a1_2>Chinatown<a1_2/><a1_1/><a1_0/> was primarily a Japanese neighborhood and today Japanese-American businesses still remain). During 1942, <a2_0><a2_1><a2_2><b8_0>Pinedale<b8_0/><a2_2/><a2_1/><a2_0/>, in what is now <b9_0>North Fresno<b9_0/>, was the site of the Pinedale Assembly Center, <a3_0><a3_1><a3_2>an interim facility for the relocation of Fresno area Japanese Americans to internment camps<a3_2/><a3_1/><a3_0/>. The Fresno Fairgrounds was also utilized as <a4_0><a4_1><a4_2>an assembly center<a4_2/><a4_1/><a4_0/>.
